thread.title: Apple iPhone chips could be supplied by a Chinese maker for first time

author: Getty Images
title: Apple iPhone chips could be supplied by a Chinese maker for first time

organizations.name: mins ago reuters getty images apple

text:
Apple is in talks to buy iPhone chips from a Chinese maker for the first time Apple is in talks to buy storage chips from Yangtze Memory Technologies. Apple will use these chips in new iPhone models and other products for sale in the Chinese domestic market specifically. Published 4 Hours Ago Reuters Getty Images Apple CEO Tim Cook (R) and Apple chief design officer Jonathan Ive (L) look at the new Apple iPhone X during an Apple special event at the Steve Jobs Theatre on the Apple Park campus on September 12, 2017 in Cupertino, California. 
Apple is in talks to buy storage chips from Yangtze Memory Technologies, a move that would mark the iPhone maker's first buy from a Chinese memory chipmaker, the Nikkei reported on Wednesday . 
Apple will use these chips in new iPhone models and other products for sale in the Chinese domestic market specifically, the Nikkei reported, citing two people familiar with the matter. 
Both Apple and Yangtze Memory did not immediately respond to requests for comment. Related Securities
